column2:
If you want to learn more about @0xstation, feel free to take a look at our own terminal page.

If you are an nft project and think that Station can help enable your community, my dms are always open :).

https://t.co/tJOvaRWWGM

/fin

I feel that using @0xstation is the first step for nft projects to empower their communities to run their own initiatives which can eventually lead to these media-empires that @janehk originally suggested.

16/x

https://t.co/EsidCCvl2T

For @tombilyeu and @impact_theory, this would help community managers broadcast all of the initiatives proposed by the community to have a better overview of which ones are ongoing.

15/x https://t.co/2PX0AbswAf

For @starcatchers, the team would be able to publish the "alpha proposal" initiative, and community members would be able to start applying for it.

Using endorsements, the core team would be able to signal which community member they want to onboard.

14/x https://t.co/GkKWkH1Kko

For @Doodles, if ever @austin_hurwitz needed project managers or maybe translators for his proposal, he'd be able to signal this as well.

Same thing for @0xshub's LearnJPEG project.

13/x https://t.co/P4DJQFQMKr

Similarly, once the @bobubeanfarmer DAO is launched, the community will be able to publish the initiatives that are currently being worked on and require help from other bobu token holders.

12/x https://t.co/ShnG5DF33H

For @AzukiZen, we'd be able to see @iFlaxson's [REDACTED] project as well as any music project that is on-going.

If @iFlaxson was looking for help, he'd also be able to broadcast it through the [REDACTED] initiative.

11/x https://t.co/ILmBikO5s2

Core members and designated community members would also be able to use endorsements to signal the talent/candidate they want to vouch for. 

This could help project leads make better decisions on who they 
want to onboard to their project.

10/x

Using our Initiative Board, communities will be able to publish on-going initiatives and designate which ones are looking for help.

9/x https://t.co/BM9ES5XGwj

This is why I'm super excited for what we've been building at @0xstation as I believe this could help out a lot of nft projects solve this exact issue.

8/x

The problem I'm seeing is that there is not a good solution out there that provides visibility of all the community-led initiatives and if they require help.

As we've all experienced, Discord is good for sync messages but terrible for organization and coordination.

7/x

Finally, there's also @TomBilyeu's @impact_theory that has a community initiatives channel where members can either post a project they are working on for the community or ask for contributors to help their project.

6/x

@StarcatchersNFT created an alpha proposal channel that will be eventually expanded to community members who want to volunteer and share projects.

5/x

Azuki is also leading the biggest community-led experiment through the @bobubeanfarmer fractionalization.

This will also create a bunch of new proposals and initiatives that other beans will be able to help manage. 

Ex: Bobu's Beans (a potential coffee brand).

3/x

First, let's start with a few examples of community-led projects:

In @AzukiZen, @iFlexson is currently working with a few other community members on [REDACTED].

There are also musician channels where fellow beans help each other out and create music together.

2/x

*disclaimer* 

I want to mention that I own most of the projects I'll be mentioning and that I'm also a contributor at Station, so my opinion could be biased.

Now that's out of the way, let's get back to thread.

Community members want to help out because they not only have a *sense* of ownership but have actual ownership in these projects.

But, as @janehk mentions, the tools to support these initiatives are lacking, which I believe @0xstation helps solve.

1/x
